title.narrative: Cleaner Production Facility for Fundacion Cardio

description.narrative: 1. Demonstration effect: IFC will help FCV lead the way demonstrating to other existing hospitals in the country that implementing clean technologies does reduce costs for a positive cost-benefit proposition. 2. Climate change: Replacing the air conditioning equipment would yield 46% reduction in current energy bills, while installing LED lighting would reduce this usage by 40% over current consumption, contributing to climate change mitigation (reduced greenhouse (GHG) emissions which will be qualified through project assessment).

The project is a Cleaner Production Lending Facility (CPLF) loan of US 1.7 million to Fundacion Cardiovascular de Colombia (Fundacion Cardio or FCV), an existing IFC client since June 2012. Fundacion Cardio (FCV) is a high complexity hospital in Bucaramanga, with 200 beds, established 25 years ago as a nonprofit foundation. It also operates three other hospitals in different cities of Colombia; Santa Marta (140 beds), Ibague (80 beds) and Manizales (135 beds). IFC has provided a US 30 million A loan to FCV for the expansion of its facilities, in a new 460 bed hospital in Bucaramanga (HIC). The hospital is under construction and should be operational by the end of 2015. The loan is targeted for the replacement of older equipment with more energy efficient models. This project is attractive for FCV as it not only provides a payback period in a moderate amount of time (for a clear financial incentive to invest) but most importantly since the new A/C system is deemed essential for hospital operations (temperature control, sterilization) and thus patient safety and comfort.
